post: Debating Matters: Transatlantic emphasizes substance over style, with students judged on the strength of their research and arguments, not just performance. Through international debates, they practice listening, empathy, and rigorous thinking with peers from the U. S. and U. K. Were grateful for the support of Carnegie Corporation of New York in helping make this transatlantic program possible. Know a student who would grow from this kind of challenge? Share this opportunity. 🔗  https://bit.ly/4aWAHd8  #DebatingMatters  #DMTA  #CivicEducation  #CriticalThinking  #PublicSpeaking

Celebrate Americas 250th all year with BRIs 2026 A250 Calendar! 12 months of American Portraits lessons plus primary sources from the Declaration, Constitution, and Bill of Rights. How will you use it in your classroom? 🔗  https://bit.ly/44u0RAi  #America250  #CivicEducation  #SocialStudies  #TeachingResources  #AmericanHistory

Some of the most meaningful gifts students give arent wrapped; theyre the positive change they create. Encourage a student to share their civic-impact story through the MyImpact Challenge. Learn more:  https://bit.ly/3fyGGr3  #MyImpactChallenge  #YouthLeadership  #CivicEngagement  #ServiceLearning

At NCSS in Washington, D. C., BRI connected with social studies educators around BRI Jr., our Government and Politics: Civics for the American Experiment curriculum, tabletop games, and more, alongside partners like iCivics and the Civic Star Challenge. What kinds of resources or formats do you most need right now to strengthen civics and social studies in your school or district? Read the recap:  https://bit.ly/4pJ87AK  #CivicEducation  #NCSS2025  #SocialStudies  #TeacherPD  #Civics

This season, most civic teachers never get one thing: real recognition for the civic work they do every day. The Civic Star Challenge is a simple way to share and celebrate those lessons. Teach a BRI civics lesson, snap a quick moment, log it in 2 minutes, and your class is eligible for $300 awards and student swag. Already celebrating teachers in 44 states. 🔗  https://bit.ly/3V1CQuX  #CivicStarChallenge  #CivicEducation  #America250  #YouthLeadership  #TeachingResources

Save a planning period with BRI Jr. Sticky History bundles! Monthly posters + stickers + ready-to-use resources. Plus, new Clara Barton + Elizabeth Eckford stickers! First 50 sign-ups get the bundle FREE, sign up by Dec. 31 for a 20% code after that. Who on your team teaches grades 3-5? Share this with them. 🔗  https://lnkd.in/eY25z6Za  #ElementaryEducation  #SocialStudies  #BRIJr  #TeacherResources  #LessonPlanning

📜  #OTD in 1791, the Bill of Rights was ratified, securing protections for speech, religion, due process, and more. In this short video, we explore how those amendments continue to shape American civic life today. How do you help students connect rights to responsibilities? 🔗 Lesson:  https://bit.ly/3uYGs7m  #TDiH  #BillOfRights  #CivicEducation  #AmericanHistory

On Bill of Rights Day, BRI President David Bobb joined C-SPANs Washington Journal to trace how the first ten amendments to the U. S. Constitution were ratified, why they still matter, and why civil disagreement is essential to citizenship. How do you mark this day? 🔗 Watch:  https://lnkd.in/ePMVY2rx  #BillOfRightsDay  #BillOfRights  #CivicEducation  #TeachingHistory

Debating Matters: Transatlantic brings U. S. high schoolers and U. K. sixth formers together to debate global issues affecting both nations. Students sharpen their arguments, compare perspectives, and practice civil discourse with peers across the Atlantic. Which students in your network should be in that conversation? Share this with them. 🔗  https://lnkd.in/epxBrefs  #DebatingMatters  #DMTA  #CivicEducation  #YouthLeadership  #Debate

The 2026 National Civics Bee helps students practice real civic skills, like researching issues, writing clearly, and answering BRI-designed civics questions in the live competition. Along the way, they build confidence, public speaking skills, and deepen their sense of civic responsibility. How could your students benefit from this experience? 🔗 Discover more:  https://lnkd.in/esNd4QDK  #NationalCivicsBee  #CivicEducation  #StudentVoice  #PublicSpeaking  #YouthLeadership
